skillTree.name: Elven Steed (Mount)
skillTree.description: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

effects.description: Passive Ability: "Keep the Distance and Keep Shooting" for Ranged Cavalry units

skillTree.name: Unicorn (Mount)
skillTree.description: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Wood Seer where their magical gifts are needed most.

effects.description: Passive Ability: "Kill the Tresspassers" for Melee Cavalry units

skillTree.name: Great Eagle (Mount)
skillTree.description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

effects.description: Passive Ability: "Death from Above" for Eagle and Hawk units

skillTree.name: Cluster of Radiants
skillTree.description: Radiants are unusual glowing Spites that usually manifest as a little more than a blurred shape of pure light. They act as magic sponges, sapping the power of enemy mages

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +5 per turn

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -5% when increasing
	(local region)
Winds of Magic power reserve: +10 per turn

Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -10% when increasing
	(local region)

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Speed of the Hunter
skillTree.description: Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.

skillTree.name: Rain of Spines
skillTree.description: A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.

skillTree.name: Howl of the Forest
skillTree.description: The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.

skillTree.name: Dance of Loec
skillTree.description: This ritualistic war dance requires neither rhythm nor order, enabling evasion of the enemyâ€™s clumsy attacks, and lethal counterattacks.

skillTree.name: Possessed by the Trickster God
skillTree.description: Once consumed by Loecâ€™s aspect, one can instinctively evade attack through trickery, mimicking his deception of the Dark Gods.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Possessed by the Trickster God"

skillTree.name: The Eye of Kurnous
skillTree.description: The Lord sets their eye upon the foe, imbuing their troops with Kurnous' spirit and the will to see his enemies destroyed.

skillTree.name: Sight Beyond Sight
skillTree.description: This Lord can spot an enemy at a distance that defies belief, and demands their troops do the same.

skillTree.name: Arrow of Kurnous
skillTree.description: When the arrow flies farther, it may kill sooner, which is vital in the Hunt.

skillTree.name: Fleetfinger
skillTree.description: Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.

skillTree.name: Piercing Shots
skillTree.description: The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.

skillTree.name: Bottomless Quiver
skillTree.description: Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Endurance of the Oak
skillTree.description: Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.

skillTree.name: Impenetrable Bark
skillTree.description: Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.

skillTree.name: Prey of Anath Raema
skillTree.description: By all means summon the bloodthirsty Goddess of the Hunt to assist you, but always make sure you thank her afterwardsâ€¦

skillTree.name: Martial Mastery (Skill Dump)
skillTree.description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.name: Defensive Dedication (Skill Dump)
skillTree.description: Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.name: Potential Energy
skillTree.description: The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Comet of Casandora"
Winds of Magic cost: -4 for "Comet of Casandora Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Comet of Casandora Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Chain Lightning"

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: The Hidden Blade
skillTree.description: The blessings of Vaul guarantee that the weapons made in Athel Loren are always ready to be used against any intruder

Melee Attack +3 for Eternal Guard units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Eyes Everywhere
skillTree.description: With the help of the Lady of the Mists, the border patrols of Athel Loren find and get rid of most trespassers with utmost efficiency

effects.description:
Ranged Weapon Strength +4% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scout and Waywatcher units
	(Lord's army)

Range Bonus +10 for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scout and Waywatcher units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Swift Vengeance
skillTree.description: A successful ambush depends on a good location, patience, skill and a devastating sudden blow from the shadows

effects.description:
Charge Bonus +4 for Dryad and all Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +4% for Dryad and all Cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus +8 for Dryad and all Cavalry units

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Friends in High Places
skillTree.description: The Wood Elves of the Grey Mountains and their feathered companions have lived sharing their homes for millennia and all of them are eager to hunt the enemies of Athel Loren

effects.description:
Melee Attack +4 for Hawk Rider and Great Eagle units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: The Last Strike
skillTree.description: Should and enemy not retreat after an endless rain of arrows decimate their lines, the Wood Elves will call some of the most skilled warriors of the Old World

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +4% for Wardancers and Wildwood Rangers units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence +12 for Wardancer and Wildwood Ranger units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Keepers of The Grove
skillTree.description: Only when a truly powerful enemy crosses the boundaries of the Forest its most ancient and mighty dwellers will arise to end the menace for good

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +4% for Treekin, Treemen and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

"Melee Defence +4 for Treekin, Treemen and Forest Dragon units"
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +7% for Treekin, Treemen and Forest Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

"Melee Defence +12 for Treekin, Treemen and Forest Dragon units"
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Shield of the Forest
skillTree.description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Nature's Quiver
skillTree.description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Swift & Sturdy
skillTree.description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Glade Riders, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: The Forest's Roar
skillTree.description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Ever-Reaching Tendrils
skillTree.description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.

skillTree.name: Wonders of the Forest
skillTree.description: Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.

skillTree.name: Nature's Salve
skillTree.description: The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.

skillTree.name: Obscuring Canopy
skillTree.description: The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.

skillTree.name: Growth of the Forest
skillTree.description: The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.

skillTree.name: Open Branches
skillTree.description: From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.

skillTree.name: Swiftfingers
skillTree.description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in themâ€¦

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.name: Perenniality
skillTree.description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.

skillTree.name: Home Amongst the Boughs
skillTree.description: The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

backgroundSkills.name: Glamourweaver
backgroundSkills.description: The Wood Seer belongs ot the Kindred of Yenayla. Sometimes known as Tree-singers or Grove-kin, they are very close to the forest, often acting as emissaries and ambassadors between the Wood Elves and the older spirits of the Athel Loren itself

effects.description:
Recruitment Cost -5% for Treekin and Treemen units
	(local province)

Recruitment Cost -10% for Treekin and Treemen units
	(local province)
